snippet.textDisplay:
Ok, ok. I know this game has far too many fanbois. I know reactors are screaming into the camere bc they want views, not that many of them ever truly loved Final Fantasy. I know there is hype, i feel it too but i will not put the rose fanboi glasses on.

Final Fantasy is losing it's charm bc of washed up colors Square Enix is using in an attempt to make this JRPG look like a more realistic and western game. Final Fantasy is about bright colors which goes with their fantasy world. Colorful Characters sticking out from the background. The beginning part is horrible. Yeah, all the details and all, we know that, every big developer can do that already. When i watch the opening sequence until nighttime, it looks like a totally different game and genre. Even Jenova in the different trailer looked like something out of Parasite Eve or Resident Evil. And nobody is saying that they should use ultra bright colors. Just don't lose you Final Fantasy flair... You already f..d up too many games in order to try to monetize the Final Fantasy name
snippet.textOriginal:
Ok, ok. I know this game has far too many fanbois. I know reactors are screaming into the camere bc they want views, not that many of them ever truly loved Final Fantasy. I know there is hype, i feel it too but i will not put the rose fanboi glasses on.

 Final Fantasy is losing it's charm bc of washed up colors Square Enix is using in an attempt to make this JRPG look like a more realistic and western game. Final Fantasy is about bright colors which goes with their fantasy world. Colorful Characters sticking out from the background. The beginning part is horrible. Yeah, all the details and all, we know that, every big developer can do that already. When i watch the opening sequence until nighttime, it looks like a totally different game and genre. Even Jenova in the different trailer looked like something out of Parasite Eve or Resident Evil. And nobody is saying that they should use ultra bright colors. Just don't lose you Final Fantasy flair... You already f..d up too many games in order to try to monetize the Final Fantasy name

snippet.textDisplay:
Wait a minute. It's clearly stated in the original game that the Midgar wasteland is the result of heavy mako extraction in the area, we can even see nature retaking its right over the region in the outro of the original game 500 years into the future. How come here there is a wasteland already before the Midgar reactors started when the city was still under construction? Makes no sense.

Otherwise great stuff, kudos for giving Barret a deeeeeeeppppp voice.
snippet.textOriginal:
Wait a minute. It's clearly stated in the original game that the Midgar wasteland is the result of heavy mako extraction in the area, we can even see nature retaking its right over the region in the outro of the original game 500 years into the future. How come here there is a wasteland already before the Midgar reactors started when the city was still under construction? Makes no sense.

Otherwise great stuff, kudos for giving Barret a deeeeeeeppppp voice.

snippet.textDisplay: Your killing me with this. I remember like it was yesterday, i was following this game from magazines and had a FF7 demo disc i got from another game. I don't remember the game that it came with because the only reason why i bought it was to get the demo. I was in ninth grade at the time it released and i begged my father that weekend to take me to the video game shop. After some persuading he agreed and when i got there they had just one more copy left. I tore open the packaging on the way home and read through the instruction manual. Do you know that feeling when you have to use the bathroom really bad and the closer you get to the toilet the worse you have to go? That was the feeling i had as we got closer to my house. I ran into my room and slammed the first disc into my PS1 and saw that intro scene that blew me away, then i had to play through the whole demo part again.... After that i was hooked for weeks and weeks. I even cut school a few times and went home, hooked the PS1 up to the big screen in the living room while my dad and gf at the time were working and played non stop. I had a magazine that had all the materia locations and combos that i would follow. In fact i still have that magazine and it's one of only a handful of things i still own from back then. This game made a poor, young, bad kid extremely happy and memorized. That's why when i see this tears want to come to my eyes. Please don't fuck this up Square Enix. That's why watching this is killing me, i need to experience that once more, even if it's the last time i will in my life. I'm ready.
snippet.textOriginal: Your killing me with this. I remember like it was yesterday, i was following this game from magazines and had a FF7 demo disc i got from another game. I don't remember the game that it came with because the only reason why i bought it was to get the demo. I was in ninth grade at the time it released and i begged my father that weekend to take me to the video game shop. After some persuading he agreed and when i got there they had just one more copy left. I tore open the packaging on the way home and read through the instruction manual. Do you know that feeling when you have to use the bathroom really bad and the closer you get to the toilet the worse you have to go? That was the feeling i had as we got closer to my house. I ran into my room and slammed the first disc into my PS1 and saw that intro scene that blew me away, then i had to play through the whole demo part again.... After that i was hooked for weeks and weeks. I even cut school a few times and went home, hooked the PS1 up to the big screen in the living room while my dad and gf at the time were working and played non stop. I had a magazine that had all the materia locations and combos that i would follow. In fact i still have that magazine and it's one of only a handful of things i still own from back then. This game made a poor, young, bad kid extremely happy and memorized. That's why when i see this tears want to come to my eyes. Please don't fuck this up Square Enix. That's why watching this is killing me, i need to experience that once more, even if it's the last time i will in my life. I'm ready.

snippet.textDisplay: I love how expressive Aeris is.  She curls her fist and sneers and almost looks like she is about to cry in front of the mako pipe because she knows what's going on with it, but it's so subtle.  There is so much more told in expressions and body language that the game was never able to do before.
snippet.textOriginal: I love how expressive Aeris is.  She curls her fist and sneers and almost looks like she is about to cry in front of the mako pipe because she knows what's going on with it, but it's so subtle.  There is so much more told in expressions and body language that the game was never able to do before.

snippet.textDisplay:
This looks stunning... but I have one minor gripe:
At 2:02 you Aerith sitting on her knees in front of a broken pipe in an ally
But then at 2:41 her dress is IMMACULATE!!
Either the ground in that ally is cleaned and maintained every day (which is unlikely given the broken pipe and garbage everywhere), or someone missed that detail when this was made.
Other than that I can't wait to play this game.
snippet.textOriginal:
This looks stunning... but I have one minor gripe:

But then at 2:41 her dress is IMMACULATE!!
Either the ground in that ally is cleaned and maintained every day (which is unlikely given the broken pipe and garbage everywhere), or someone missed that detail when this was made.
Other than that I can't wait to play this game.

snippet.textDisplay:
Barret sounds like the typical stereotypical black male from black exploitation films! The only black man in the game, and he talks like that! And, his high-top fade is slicked back like he has a relaxer in it! An outdated hair due and an outdated way of speaking! Can the racism from the Japanese get any better than white supremacists' racism? We'll see...!



(Low Spoiler Alert!)
What happened to the real-life effects of being sliced and diced with a giant ass sword?! Why does the bodies vanish like fairy dust? What?! No blood, guts, and flying limbs? So, is ole girl going to get a bloodless piecing through her back and vanish like those soldiers when impelled by ole dude with the long samurai sword? I'm not implying a bloody mess is better! But if you're going to do something with swords and machine gun bullets, you might as well go all out! Leave the blood splattered stains and meat chunks on the ground and all! Get em all on the characters too! But hey...!
snippet.textOriginal:
Barret sounds like the typical stereotypical black male from black exploitation films! The only black man in the game, and he talks like that! And, his high-top fade is slicked back like he has a relaxer in it! An outdated hair due and an outdated way of speaking! Can the racism from the Japanese get any better than white supremacists' racism? We'll see...!



(Low Spoiler Alert!)
What happened to the real-life effects of being sliced and diced with a giant ass sword?! Why does the bodies vanish like fairy dust? What?! No blood, guts, and flying limbs? So, is ole girl going to get a bloodless piecing through her back and vanish like those soldiers when impelled by ole dude with the long samurai sword? I'm not implying a bloody mess is better! But if you're going to do something with swords and machine gun bullets, you might as well go all out! Leave the blood splattered stains and meat chunks on the ground and all! Get em all on the characters too! But hey...!

snippet.textDisplay: New Sehpiroth voice pales in comparison to George Newbern. WHY did you keep the old Japanese voice actors but boot the english ones? It makes your "we want to take the game in a fresh new direction" reasoning BULLSH*T. By keeping the old Japanese voice crew you'll sell millions in just Japan so I'm sure Square doesn't care. Square's recent major f*ck ups have permanently removed my nostalgia goggles, little to no chance I buy a ps4/ps5 for this remake 😟

snippet.textDisplay:
You never really saw Midgar in the daytime in the original game (because using lighting effectively wasn't a thing), so OK, hopefully this game will have day-night cycles in all environments.


I'm still not buying a Playstation just for this game, tho. :P
snippet.textOriginal:
You never really saw Midgar in the daytime in the original game (because using lighting effectively wasn't a thing), so OK, hopefully this game will have day-night cycles in all environments.


I'm still not buying a Playstation just for this game, tho. :P

snippet.textDisplay: It's funny how some bitch about a line from one-winged angel being apart of the intro. however, if those who actually understand what they are saying (which is  "Burning inside, with violent rage") would get why it works for this scene. To be honest the phrase is quite appropriate for Midgar especially the nature of it, and the reactors surrounding it. What is creepy is when they say "burning inside" when the reactor turns on,  and then you realize that mako is souls, and it's being burned up for electrical production. A lot of thought went into the new intro it seems.
snippet.textOriginal: It's funny how some bitch about a line from one-winged angel being apart of the intro. however, if those who actually understand what they are saying (which is  "Burning inside, with violent rage") would get why it works for this scene. To be honest the phrase is quite appropriate for Midgar especially the nature of it, and the reactors surrounding it. What is creepy is when they say "burning inside" when the reactor turns on,  and then you realize that mako is souls, and it's being burned up for electrical production. A lot of thought went into the new intro it seems.

snippet.textDisplay:
Better than the leaked version - the camera cuts feel less jarring when the "original opening" is part of a longer scene showing the wider city first.
Still think this version looses some of the impact of that first single shot pull back camera movement to reveal the scale of Midgar that was so iconic in the original game, which is a shame.
Can't help but wonder if they ever considered making this a single shot opening scene, I think that could have been truly spectacular.
snippet.textOriginal:
Better than the leaked version - the camera cuts feel less jarring when the "original opening" is part of a longer scene showing the wider city first. 
Still think this version looses some of the impact of that first single shot pull back camera movement to reveal the scale of Midgar that was so iconic in the original game, which is a shame.
Can't help but wonder if they ever considered making this a single shot opening scene, I think that could have been truly spectacular.

snippet.textDisplay:
I cried.
So many memories.
It's seems like it was just yesterday.
7 year old me playing ff7 on my Playstation.
House is full and restless as always.
Mom cooking in the kitchen.
Dad sleeping on the couch after a long days work.
And me, my brother, and sister all huddled around the tv watching each other play FF7.
God I would give anything to have those days back...
snippet.textOriginal:
I cried. 
So many memories.
It's seems like it was just yesterday.
7 year old me playing ff7 on my Playstation.
House is full and restless as always.
Mom cooking in the kitchen. 
Dad sleeping on the couch after a long days work.
And me, my brother, and sister all huddled around the tv watching each other play FF7.
God I would give anything to have those days back...

snippet.textDisplay: I remember playing the Demo for this game on a PS1 sample disc in 1995 or 96.  Bought it day 1 and beat it 2 or 3 times, sold all my games but kept the OG PS1 console, bought it again at nearly full price about 10 years ago and have played it another 3 or 4 times.  This game is my entire life.  Please take care of my Life!!!!

This game is my entire life.  Please take care of my Life!!!!
